t: How*pn she sits alone, the*ln city once crowded with people! She*ln who was great among the nations has*ln become like a widow. The*ln princess among the provinces has*ln been put to forced labor.

She*pn weeps bitterly during the night, with*ln tears on her cheeks. There*ln is no one to offer her comfort, not*ln one from all her lovers. All*ln her friends have betrayed her; they*ln have become her enemies.
Judah*pn has gone into exile following*ln affliction and harsh slavery; she*ln lives among the nations but*ln finds no place to rest. All*ln her pursuers have overtaken her in*ln narrow places.
The*pn roads to Zion mourn, for*ln no one comes to the appointed festivals. All*ln her gates are deserted; her*ln priests groan, her*ln young women grieve, and*ln she herself is bitter.

Her*pn adversaries have become her masters; her*ln enemies are at ease, for*ln the Lord*s has made her suffer because*ln of her many transgressions. Her*ln children have gone away as*ln captives before the adversary.
All*pn the splendor has vanished from*ln Daughter Zion. Her*ln leaders are like stags that*ln find no pasture; they*ln stumble away exhausted before*ln the hunter.

During*pn the days of her affliction and homelessness Jerusalem*ln remembers all her precious belongings that*ln were hers in days of old. When*ln her people fell into the adversary’s hand, she*ln had no one to help. The*ln adversaries looked at her, laughing*ln over her downfall.
Jerusalem*pn has sinned grievously; therefore,*ln she has become an object of scorn. All*ln who honored her now despise her, for*ln they have seen her nakedness. She*ln herself groans and turns away.
Her*pn uncleanness stains her skirts. She*ln never considered her end. Her*ln downfall was astonishing; there*ln was no one to comfort her. Lord,*sln look on my affliction, for*ln the enemy boasts.
The*pn adversary has seized all*ln her precious belongings. She*ln has even seen the nations enter*ln her sanctuary — those*ln you had forbidden to*ln enter your assembly.
All*pn her people groan while*ln they search for bread. They*ln have traded their precious belongings for food in*ln order to stay alive. Lord,*sln look and see how*ln I have become despised.
Is*pn this nothing to you, all you who pass by? Look*ln and see! Is*ln there any pain like mine, which*ln was dealt out to me, which*ln the Lord*s made me suffer on*ln the day of his burning anger?
He*pn sent fire from on high into my bones; he*ln made it descend. He*ln spread a net for my feet and*ln turned me back. He*ln made me desolate, sick*ln all day long.

My*pn transgressions have been formed into a yoke, fastened*ln together by his hand; they*ln have been placed on my neck, and*ln the Lord has broken my strength. He*ln has handed me over to*ln those I cannot withstand.

The*pn Lord has rejected all*ln the mighty men within me. He*ln has summoned an army against me to*ln crush my young warriors. The*ln Lord has trampled Virgin Daughter Judah like*ln grapes in a winepress.
I*pn weep because of these things; my*ln eyes flow with tears. For*ln there is no one nearby to comfort me, no*ln one to keep me alive. My*ln children are desolate because*ln the enemy has prevailed.

Zion*pn stretches out her hands; there*ln is no one to comfort her. The*ln Lord*s has issued a decree against Jacob that*ln his neighbors should be his adversaries. Jerusalem*ln has become something*ln impure among them.
The*pn Lord*s is just, for*ln I have rebelled against his command. Listen,*ln all you people; look*ln at my pain. My*ln young women and young men have*ln gone into captivity.
I*pn called to my lovers, but*ln they betrayed me. My*ln priests and elders perished*ln in the city while*ln searching for food to*ln keep themselves alive.
Lord,*spn see how I am in distress. I*ln am churning within; my*ln heart is broken, for*ln I have been very rebellious. Outside,*ln the sword takes the children; inside,*ln there is death.

People*pn have heard me groaning, but*ln there is no one to comfort me. All*ln my enemies have heard of my misfortune; they*ln are glad that you have caused it. Bring*ln on the day you have announced, so*ln that they may become like me.
Let*pn all their wickedness come before you, and*ln deal with them as*ln you have dealt with me because*ln of all my transgressions. For*ln my groans are many, and*ln I am sick at heart.
